page.title: 05LOCAL TRAVEL IN CUMBERNAULD
page.content: To travel around Cumbernauld we can use paths or roads.For speed we normally use the roads.We have three main ways of travelling by road and these are by cars,bus or taxi.In my class of 25 children, 20 have cars at home. This means we often travel around or to and from Cumbernauld by car.But if the car can't be used most people then use the local bus.The bus company is{W. Alexander & Sons}and they have services in the town and into Glasgow and other nearby towns,such as Stirling and Falkirk.We can also,use taxis{which are popular {from the shopping centre at the {weekend.}Trains run from our town to Glasgow or from{Croy village}which also has trains to Edinburgh.
